divs: Sighting DetailsTwo pale red lights seen above West Chester, Pa at 9:58pm on April 2, 2012. I was standing in my backyard, smoking a cigarette (bad me), looking at the sky and saw the lights traveling in a slightly offset linear formation heading north-west. I immediately regarded them as something I have not witnessed in the past and pointed at them, saying to my wife standing next to me, "Do you see that? What is that?" I pointed my fingers at the object(s) as they crossed the sky. Our in-town home does not provide much vantage to the night sky, but I would say that I saw the lights pass for about 7 seconds until they were overcome by neighboring trees. My wife never did see what I was pointing at. The lights were steady, but pale, and I was not particularly surprised that she didn't see them-- but I was frustrated that she didn't. The pale red lights were silent as they passed overhead. A few minutes later some small planes flew by with all the telltale signs of being planes---red and green lights, strobes, noise.. I have no idea as to their distance in the sky, but the two lights were approximately an index and ring finger apart if spread in a V, just slightly offset. I just read the 6 points at the side so.. 1. Home outside 2. Looking at stars.. i just do that when I smoke. 3. Something odd. I hadn't seen that before in the sky, so nothing came to mind, except to look. Although, I first thought it was one object with a red light in front and in back; I never saw anything between the lights--and then because the lights were offset, I just assumed them to be two different separate items. Either way, the lights maintained a steady distance, offset and speed from each other. 4. Very steady, straight NW heading 5. Just thought it was weird. 6. Trees
trends: There have been 10 other sightings in West Chester
There were no other sightings in West Chester on or around April 2nd 2012
Summary: 2 pale red lights over West Chester, Pa. 4/02/2012, heading NW in linear offset formation.
